Comment: This 💯%. Don’t forget personal care items like soap, body washes, shampoos, razor heads, lotions, etc. A lot of these will state somewhere on the container what it’s made of - ‘made from domestic and international ingredients’. If it contains something produced outside the U.S. it should be stocked up on. Really, even if it’s made in the U.S. because, you know, tariffs and corporate price-gouging. Basic necessities like  underwear, T’s, socks and shoes are a good idea too.   I refuse to pay for my next (already spendy) running shoes with an ungodly, unnecessary tariff attached to it. 🙄
Author: PickledKingPin

Comment: The first thing I did the day after Election Day was schedule surgery to be medically sterilized.  Then, I started stockpiling goods and food. I have probably half a year of canned goods stocked; they do go bad, so I didn’t go TOO crazy. And then I turned into a prepper and ordered probably another 18 months of freeze-dried canned food. 18 months if we’re just supporting me and my husband. Less if we have to support friends and family. We have a trans friend we told we’d hide in our house if need be. We have Puerto Rican friend we told the same to, but he says he’ll just go back to PR if necessary. (If he has a chance to before ICE decides he’s not an American after ll.) I have a very good friend who is a naturalized citizen who immigrated here from China when she was a kid. On the plus side, my cousin’s husband’s parent is Canadian, and apparently that’s close enough to allow him and his family and also us to move Canada.   I still can’t believe I’m talking about this kind of shit. “I’m sorry. I thought this was America.”
Author: Damn_Dog_Inappropes
